page.title: 02Farming
page.content: Farming here has changed even within the last 50 yrs. Before the 1940's the land was light and only suitable for sheep, but developments, spurred on by the war, led to artificial fertilizers allowing cereal crops to grow and dairy cattle to be raised. There are 4 farms in the area:- {Whitcombe Farm, Higher Came Farm,}and {Came Home Farm}each of about 1000 acres, and{Herringston Farm and Dairy} of about 500. All have arable land but whereas Whitcombe Farm has a flock of sheep, the others have dairy cattle. The farms produce most of their winter cattle feed - hay, silage and kale. Crops grown include cereals - wheat, barley, and oats with root crops such as potatoes. Increasingly rape, a high yielding crop for oil, is grown. As farming becomes yet more mechanized, the manpower continues to be reduced.
